pr_title: Add step 'When I wait for 'responseCode' response code for HTTP httpM…

timeline.bodyText: do not use any to verify expected successful invocations, use eq, argThat and etc.
timeline.author: valfirst

timeline.bodyText: constants used once could be inlined
timeline.author: valfirst
valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -202,6 +204,39 @@ public void setCustomRequestConfig(ExamplesTable configItems) throws ReflectiveO httpTestContext.putRequestConfig(requestConfigBuilder.build()); } + /** + * Step sends HTTP request for the given url and waits for a specified amount of time + * until HTTP response code is equal to what is expected and stores HTTP response into Scenario-level variable.
+ * This step can use the request body that was set before. + * Request body shouldn't be set for methods that can't contain body (GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE), + * and should be set for methods that must contain body (PATCH, POST, PUT). + * + * @param responseCode for example 200, 404 + * @param httpMethod HTTP method type. Parameter accepts the following HTTP methods: + *
    + *
  • GET
    • + *
  • HEAD
    • + *
  • POST
    • + *
  • PUT
    • + *
  • OPTIONS
    • + *
  • DELETE
    • + *
  • TRACE
    • + *
  • PATCH
    • + *
+ * @param url for example https://www.vividus.org/sitemap.xml + * @param duration Time duration to wait + * @param retryTimes How many times request will be retried; duration/retryTimes=timeout between requests + * @throws IOException If an input or output exception occurred + */ + @When("When I wait for '$responseCode' response code for HTTP $httpMethod request for a resource " + + "with the URL '$url' for '$duration' duration retrying $retryTimes times") + public void waitForResponse(int responseCode, HttpMethod httpMethod, String url, Duration duration,

timeline.bodyText: and stores HTTP response into Scenario-level variable
timeline.author: valfirst

timeline.bodyText:
@When("I wait for `$responseCode` response code for HTTP $httpMethod request to resource "
           + "`$resourceUrl` for `$duration` duration retrying $retryTimes times")
timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -202,6 +204,39 @@ public void setCustomRequestConfig(ExamplesTable configItems) throws ReflectiveO httpTestContext.putRequestConfig(requestConfigBuilder.build()); } + /** + * Step sends HTTP request for the given url and waits for a specified amount of time + * until HTTP response code is equal to what is expected and stores HTTP response into Scenario-level variable.
+ * This step can use the request body that was set before. + * Request body shouldn't be set for methods that can't contain body (GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE), + * and should be set for methods that must contain body (PATCH, POST, PUT). + * + * @param responseCode for example 200, 404 + * @param httpMethod HTTP method type. Parameter accepts the following HTTP methods: + *
    + *
  • GET
    • + *
  • HEAD

replies.bodyText:
Also what about making this step a bit more universal:
@When("I wait for response code `$responseCode` for `$duration` duration retrying $retryTimes times"
        + "$stepsToExecute")

?
replies.author: valfirst

timeline.message: Add step 'When I wait for 'responseCode' response code for HTTP httpMethod request for a resource with the URL 'url' for 'duration' duration retrying retryTimes times'
Add step 'When I wait for 'responseCode' response code for HTTP httpMethod request for a resource with the URL 'url' for 'duration' duration retrying retryTimes times'

timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -202,6 +207,42 @@ public void setCustomRequestConfig(ExamplesTable configItems) throws ReflectiveO httpTestContext.putRequestConfig(requestConfigBuilder.build()); } + /** + * Waits for a specified amount of time until HTTP response code is equal to what is expected. + *

+ * Actions performed: + *

+ *
    + *
  • Execute sub-steps
    • + *
  • Check if HTTP response code is equal to what is expected
    • + *
+ * + * @param responseCode for example 200, 404 + * @param duration Time duration to wait + * @param retryTimes How many times request will be retried; duration/retryTimes=timeout between requests + * @param stepsToExecute Steps to execute at each wait iteration + */ + @When("I wait for response code `$responseCode` for `$duration` duration retrying $retryTimes times" + + "$stepsToExecute") + public void waitForResponseCode(int responseCode, Duration duration, int retryTimes, + SubSteps stepsToExecute) + { + new Waiter(new WaitMode(duration, retryTimes)).wait( + () -> stepsToExecute.execute(Optional.empty()), + () -> isResponseCodeIsEqualToExpected(httpTestContext.getResponse(), responseCode) + ); + } + + private boolean isResponseCodeIsEqualToExpected(HttpResponse response, int expectedResponseCode) + { + if (response == null) + { + return false; + } + int statusCode = response.getStatusCode();

timeline.bodyText:
in general the full method can be like:
return response != null && response.getStatusCode() == expectedResponseCode;
timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -202,6 +207,42 @@ public void setCustomRequestConfig(ExamplesTable configItems) throws ReflectiveO httpTestContext.putRequestConfig(requestConfigBuilder.build()); } + /** + * Waits for a specified amount of time until HTTP response code is equal to what is expected. + *

+ * Actions performed: + *

+ *
    + *
  • Execute sub-steps
    • + *
  • Check if HTTP response code is equal to what is expected
    • + *
+ * + * @param responseCode for example 200, 404 + * @param duration Time duration to wait + * @param retryTimes How many times request will be retried; duration/retryTimes=timeout between requests + * @param stepsToExecute Steps to execute at each wait iteration + */ + @When("I wait for response code `$responseCode` for `$duration` duration retrying $retryTimes times" + + "$stepsToExecute") + public void waitForResponseCode(int responseCode, Duration duration, int retryTimes, + SubSteps stepsToExecute) + { + new Waiter(new WaitMode(duration, retryTimes)).wait( + () -> stepsToExecute.execute(Optional.empty()), + () -> isResponseCodeIsEqualToExpected(httpTestContext.getResponse(), responseCode) + ); + } + + private boolean isResponseCodeIsEqualToExpected(HttpResponse response, int expectedResponseCode) + { + if (response == null) + { + return false; + } + int statusCode = response.getStatusCode(); + return statusCode == expectedResponseCode;

timeline.bodyText: this peace of code can be put on the previous line
timeline.author: valfirst

timeline.bodyText:
missing tests for cases:

response == null
response.code == expected response code

timeline.bodyText: this test and the previous one can be combined and data-driven approach can be applied: https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#writing-tests-parameterized-tests-sources-MethodSource

timeline.bodyText: decrease duration and number of retries to some minimal value (10 seconds - too much for unit test)
timeline.author: valfirst

timeline.bodyText:
what about emulation of real behavior:

1 attempt - return http response with any code, but not 200
2 attempt - return http response with code 200
?
timeline.author: valfirst
